question.title: Turning off JFR events with startup args
question.body:
Im trying to understand if it is possible to turn off certain JFR events for sanitizing reasons using startup args. I know it is possible to scrub the file after downloading it, and that works just fine but i would prefer to just have startup args to do that instead.

I cant seem to find any good resources about how to use these args.

I've found this SO thread, which says it is possible, atleast in JDK 17 SO thread to do just this, however it seems to me that those suggested args have no effect whatsoever to my JFR recordings.

suggested args:

$ java 
  -XX:StartFlightRecording:
  jdk.InitialEnvironmentVariable#enabled=false,
  jdk.InitialSystemProperty#enabled=false
  ...

possible problems with my project:

  • In my project, im currently using JDK 25, is this a version problem?
  • Is there a problem with the syntax im using in docker-entrypoint? Im not entirely sure how to pass the additional jdk. args with the XX:StartFlightRecording

my args:

exec java \
  ...
  -XX:+UseStringDeduplication \
  -XX:NativeMemoryTracking=detail \
  -XX:StartFlightRecording:jdk.InitialEnvironmentVariable#enabled=false,jdk.InitialSystemProperty#enabled=false \
  ...

answers.body:
What you have looks correct and I tried it on JDK 25 and it worked.

To get more information, you can do:

$ java -XX:StartFlightRecording:help  

event-setting=value (Optional) The event setting value to modify. Use 
                    the form <event-name>#<setting-name>=value.   

...   
For more information about settings syntax, see Javadoc of the 
jdk.jfr package.

https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/25/docs/api/jdk.jfr/jdk/jfr/package-summary.html
